intro: Allosorus pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's alpine buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and often toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are typically surrounded by white or green sepals. It thrives in cool, moist environments such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Allosorus pringlei is an important species in its native habitat, contributing to local biodiversity and ecological stability.
